channel.title: Java problems
channel.description:
Hello, So I use a 317 loading 602 source on my vps... well my vps is really weak and only has 512mb of ram so I'm trying to figure out a way to make java not crash as often [code] # # A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment: # # java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: requested 2013616 bytes for Chunk::new. Out of swap space? # # Internal Error (allocation.cpp:215), pid=3212, tid=68588 # Error: Chunk::new # # JRE version: 6.0_21-b07 # Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (17.0-b17 mixed mode windows-amd64 ) # If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit: # http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp #[/code]
This is the only thing I'm hosting and not doing anything else on it, but it still crashes..

item.title: Java problems
item.dc:creator: @BigAbdul BigAbdul
item.description:
@BigAbdul wrote:

[quote=“ApocalypseX, post:2, topic:398476”][quote author=BigAbdul link=topic=495612.msg3623404#msg3623404 date=1307641060]
Hello, So I use a 317 loading 602 source on my vps… well my vps is really weak and only has 512mb of ram so I’m trying to figure out a way to make java not crash as often

[code]

A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:

java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: requested 2013616 bytes for Chunk::new. Out of swap space?

Internal Error (allocation.cpp:215), pid=3212, tid=68588

Error: Chunk::new

JRE version: 6.0_21-b07

Java VM: Java HotSpot™ 64-Bit Server VM (17.0-b17 mixed mode windows-amd64 )

If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:

http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp

#[/code]

This is the only thing I’m hosting and not doing anything else on it, but it still crashes…
[/quote]

This means your computer is out of memory, and the source/client uses too much memory space (e.g Java Runtime is using a lot of computer memory) will pop up if you have Norton.[/quote]…

[quote=“BigAbdul, post:1, topic:398476”]Hello, So I use a 317 loading 602 source on my vps… well my vps is really weak and only has 512mb of ram so I’m trying to figure out a way to make java not crash as often

[code]

A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:

java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: requested 2013616 bytes for Chunk::new. Out of swap space?

Internal Error (allocation.cpp:215), pid=3212, tid=68588

Error: Chunk::new

JRE version: 6.0_21-b07

Java VM: Java HotSpot™ 64-Bit Server VM (17.0-b17 mixed mode windows-amd64 )

If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:

http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp

#[/code]

This is the only thing I’m hosting and not doing anything else on it, but it still crashes…[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Java problems
item.dc:creator: @ApocalypseX ApocalypseX
item.description:
@ApocalypseX wrote:

[quote=“BigAbdul, post:1, topic:398476”]Hello, So I use a 317 loading 602 source on my vps… well my vps is really weak and only has 512mb of ram so I’m trying to figure out a way to make java not crash as often

[code]

A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:

java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: requested 2013616 bytes for Chunk::new. Out of swap space?

Internal Error (allocation.cpp:215), pid=3212, tid=68588

Error: Chunk::new

JRE version: 6.0_21-b07

Java VM: Java HotSpot™ 64-Bit Server VM (17.0-b17 mixed mode windows-amd64 )

If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:

http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp

#[/code]

This is the only thing I’m hosting and not doing anything else on it, but it still crashes…[/quote]

This means your computer is out of memory, and the source/client uses too much memory space (e.g Java Runtime is using a lot of computer memory) will pop up if you have Norton.

Read full topic
